intro: Micromeria xalapensis, commonly known as the Xalapa micromeria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
